sen.j: 市原駅（いちはらえき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Ichihara Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Ichihara Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Ichihara Station, located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 1面1線のプラットホーム形状のみを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: An aboveground station with only one platform serving one track.
It is an aboveground station with only one platform serving one track.
It is an aboveground station with only one platform serving one track.

sen.j: 無人駅である。
sen.e: An unmanned station.
It's an unmanned station.
It's an unmanned station.

sen.j: 早朝深夜には当駅折り返し列車も存在する。
sen.e: Some trains arrive at and depart from this station early in the morning and at night.
Some trains arrive at and depart from this station early in the morning and at night.
Some trains arrive at and depart from this station early in the morning and late at night.

sen.j: ホームの両端に出入り口があるが主要な出入り口はホームの出町柳駅側であり、こちらの出入り口から集落の方へ石段を下ったところには、叡山電鉄が設置した無料駐輪場がある。
sen.e: There are entrances at both ends of the platform, a main entrance being located on the Demachiyanagi Station side, and going down the stone steps from the main entrance toward the village leads to a free bicycle parking area which was built by the Eizan Electric Railway.

There are entrances at both ends of the platform, a main entrance being located on the Demachiyanagi Station side, and going down the stone steps from the main entrance toward the village leads to a free bicycle parking area that was built by the Eizan Electric Railway.

There are entrances at both ends of the platform, a main entrance being located on the Demachiyanagi Station side, and going down the stone steps from the main entrance toward the village leads to a free bicycle parking area that was built by the Eizan Electric Railway.

sen.j: また、ホームのすぐ出町柳駅側に構内踏切扱いの第4種踏切があり、府道とは反対側の集落へと行くことができる。
sen.e: There is a level crossing (Class 4) in the station just next to the platform on the Demachiyanagi Station side, which leads to the village on the opposite side of the Prefecture Road.
There is a level crossing (Class 4) in the station just next to the platform on the Demachiyanagi Station side, which leads to the village on the opposite side of the prefectural road.
There is a level crossing (Class 4) in the station just next to the platform on the Demachiyanagi Station side, which leads to the village on the opposite side of the prefectural route.
sen.cmt: 府道をprefectural routeとしました。

sen.j: ホームのぼぼすべてを覆う上屋が設置されている。
sen.e: A roof covers almost the entire platform.
A roof covers nearly the entire platform.
A roof covers nearly the entire platform.

sen.j: 鞍馬駅側の出口のすぐ脇に「伝・後藤顕乗の墓石」と伝えられる墓がある。
sen.e: There is a tomb called 'Kenjo GOTO's tombstone' just next to the entrance on the Kurama Station side.
There is a tomb called 'Kenjo GOTO's tombstone' just next to the entrance on the Kurama Station side.
There is a tomb called 'Kenjo GOTO's tombstone' just next to the entrance on the Kurama Station side.

sen.j: 駅前と言うべき所からは、レール面からホーム面までのゆるい階段のみであるが、駅自体が府道から石段を上がったところに立地しているので、車椅子等での利用は一見困難に見えるが、府道から駅の少し出町柳駅側にある「大神宮社」という神社の参道を経由し、上記の第4種踏切を渡るとスロープのみで駅ホームに到達できる。
sen.e: As the station is located at the top of the stone steps from the Prefecture Road, and from the track level to the platform level is accessed by gentle stairs, the accessibility to the station is seemingly limited for a person in wheelchairs, but the station can also be reached from the Prefecture Road via an approach to the shrine called 'Daijingusha' located on the Demachiyanagi Station side close to the station, via the level crossing (Class 4), and then a slope up to the platform.

Because the station is located at the top of the stone steps from the prefectural road, and the route from the track level to the platform level is accessed by gentle stairs, the accessibility to the station is seemingly limited for persons in wheelchairs; however, the station can also be reached from the prefectural road via an approach to the shrine called 'Daijingusha' located on the Demachiyanagi Station side close to the station, via the level crossing (Class 4), and then a slope up to the platform.

Because the station is located at the top of the stone steps from the prefectural route, and since gentle stairs are the only way to get to the platform level from the track level, the accessibility to the station is seemingly limited for persons in wheelchairs; however, the station can also be reached from the prefectural route via an approach to the shrine called 'Daijingusha' located on the Demachiyanagi Station side close to the station, via the level crossing (Class 4) and a slope up to the platform.
sen.cmt: 府道をprefectural routeとしました。表現の修正

sen.j: かつてはこの駅まで複線区間となっていたが、日中戦争中の1939年に単線化された。
sen.e: The station used to be an end of a double track section, but the station became a single track in 1939 during the Sino-Japanese war.
The station used to be the end of a double track section, but it became a single track in 1939 during the Sino-Japanese War.
The station used to be the end of a double track section, but it became a single track in 1939 during the Sino-Japanese War.

sen.j: その後1990年に二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)まで再度複線化された後も、今なお単線のままとなっている。
sen.e: The station remains a single track even after the line between the Iwakura Station and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again in 1990.
The station remains a single track even after the line between Iwakura Station and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again in 1990.
The station remains a single track even after the line between Iwakura Station and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) became a double track again in 1990.

sen.j: 現在のホームの向かい側にあるホーム跡や、駅のすぐ鞍馬駅側にある橋梁の複線分の橋脚、駅の出町柳駅側にある神社である「大神宮社」の参道に架かる橋梁に残された鋼鉄製の橋桁などに、複線時代の痕跡を残している。
sen.e: The evidence of the double track can be found in the remains of the old platform on the opposite side of the current platform, piers of the bridge for a double track located just next to the Kurama Station side of the station, or a steel bridge beam remaining on the bridge over the approach to the 'Daijingusha' shrine located on the Demachiyanagi side of the station.

The evidence of the double track can be found in the remains of the old platform on the opposite side of the current platform, the piers of the bridge for a double track located just next to the Kurama Station side of the station, or a steel bridge beam remaining on the bridge over the approach to the 'Daijingusha' shrine located on the Demachiyanagi side of the station.

The evidence of the double track can be found in the remains of the old platform on the opposite side of the current platform, the piers of the bridge for a double track located just next to the Kurama Station side of the station, or a steel bridge beam remaining on the bridge over the approach to the 'Daijingusha' shrine located on the Demachiyanagi side of the station.

sen.j: 京都府道38号京都広河原美山線（鞍馬街道）から数10m入った所より石段を上がった所にある。
sen.e: The station is located at the top of the stone steps, several tens of meters from the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyamasen Kyoto Fudo 38 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 38) (Kurama-kaido).
The station is located at the top of the stone steps, several tens of meters from the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyamasen Kyoto Fudo 38 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 38) (Kurama-kaido).
The station is located at the top of the stone steps, several tens of meters from the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyama Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 38 (Kurama-kaido).
sen.cmt: Kyoto-hirogawara-miyama Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 38としました。

sen.j: かつては集落の中心であり、商店や農協などがある。
sen.e: The station used to be the center of the village, and there are stores and Japan Agricultural Cooperatives.
The station used to be the center of the village, and there were stores and Japan Agricultural Cooperatives.
The station used to be the center of the village, and there are still stores and Japan Agricultural Cooperatives.

sen.j: 現在は中心部が古くからの住宅、周辺の山沿いは新しい住宅が中心という典型的な山間の住宅地である。
sen.e: Now the surrounding area is a typical residential area in the mountains where old houses are situated in the center and new houses mainly stand along the surrounding mountains.
Today the surrounding area is a typical residential area in the mountains where old houses are situated in the center and new houses mainly stand along the surrounding mountains.
Today the surrounding area is a typical residential area in the mountains where old houses are situated in the center and new houses mainly stand along the surrounding mountains.

sen.j: 補陀洛寺（通称小町寺）
sen.e: Fudaraku-ji Temple (called Komachi-dera)
Fudaraku-ji Temple (called Komachi-dera)
Fudaraku-ji Temple (called Komachi-dera)

sen.j: 左京区役所静市出張所
sen.e: Sakyo Ward Office, Shizuichi Branch
Sakyo Ward Office, Shizuichi Branch

sen.e: Kyoto Municipal Ichiharano Shogakko (Elementary School)

sen.j: 京都市東北部清掃工場（市北部クリーンセンター）
sen.e: Kyoto City Tohokubu Seiso-kojo (Shihokubu Clean Center) (Garbage and sewage plant)

sen.e: Kyoto Shizuichi Ichihara Post Office

tit.e: Momiji no Tonneru (tunnel) on the Kurama Line, the Eizan Electric Railway between Ichihara and Ninose

sen.e: Ichiharaekimae (on the Kyoto-hirogawara-miyamasen Kyoto Fudo 38 Go from the Demachiyanagi side of the station)

sen.j: 市原 （駅から鞍馬側の階段を降り、人道橋、住宅地、市原小学校前を経て約300mの京都府道40号下鴨静原大原線沿い）
sen.e: Ichihara (down the steps on the Kurama side of the station, via a pedestrian overpass, a residential area, the Ichihara Elementary School, and about 300 meters to the Shimogamo-shizuhara-oharasen Kyoto Fudo 40 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 40))

Ichihara (down the steps on the Kurama side of the station, reachable via a pedestrian overpass, a residential area and the Ichihara Elementary School, and about 300 meters to the Shimogamo-shizuhara-ohara Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 40)

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 - 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
The station opened on December 1, 1928 under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.
December 1, 1928: The station opened under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年）9月 - 二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)～当駅間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: In September 1939, the line between the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
In September 1939, the line between the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and the Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.
September 1939: The line between Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Ichihara Station became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 - 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942 the station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 - 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of reorganization of companies.
On April 1, 1986 the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
